fields.description: I know I can (and do) run gant builds as a script.  But it would be better :) and add Bamboo visibility if Gant were considered a native builder like Ant.  For instance: "Hudson already has it" referring to Gant support.  I am thinking an Ant like clone is about all that is needed.
fields.summary: Gant support

fields.description: See http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/2008/12/05/Sun+JRE-JDK+Vulnerabilities
fields.summary: Upgrade Elastic Agent image to DLJ JDK 6u11, to address security vulnerabilities

fields.description:
At the moment, the login private key (of which there is one per EC2 account) is stored in the administration configuration XML file at the time it is generated.

Instead, it needs to be placed in a file in bamboo home that is suitable for use with the ssh command.

Include user-supplied data in image filename

fields.description:
Bamboo is extremely slow in my office: half the time pages time out completely and must be refreshed, the other half of the time, pages take over 30 seconds to load and jump around spastically during that time as the text and then images for each plan appear.  This makes it very frustrating to simply go in, press a single button and leave, and often I end up hitting the wrong button because the links moved.  If all the little icons at least had a width and height set in the html this would go a long way to solving things.

Ideally, since Bamboo seems to be designed to run on build servers which can be extremely slow machines, the interface should be dead simple html: no tables, no ajax, just a list of the important links you came there for and nothing more.  I would love to see a text and links only version of the Current Activity, All Plans and My Favorite Plans pages.
fields.summary: Use a set height for each plan on My Favorite Plans so page doesn't jump around while loading

fields.description: The Bamboo Upgrade Guide at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Upgrade+Guide calls for reconfiguring external user repositories (if applicable) as Step 8, after starting Bamboo in Step 5. This seems odd, since in order for the new atlassian-user.xml file to take effect, you have to stop, then start Bamboo again. Is there a reason why the atlassian-user.xml file can't be copied into the new Bamboo installation as part of the re-install?
fields.summary: Bamboo Upgrade Guide may call for reconfiguring external user repositories in wrong order
Global Variables list in Administration panel is sorted randomly
Give agent ability to retrieve its image ID

fields.description:
There are some flaws in the current import export code which mean that we can not export elastic agents.  Elastic agents will be essentially the same as Remote agents except without a capability set.

There are two issues with the current import/export and once these are solved it should be easy for me to just start exporting a new type of agent.

Problem 1:  Currently the export of capability sets are broken. All CapabilitySets are imported/exported as local (when some are remote). Currently agents use enums to differentiate between agent type, perhaps we need the same thing for the capabilities.  

Problem 2:  I need to be able to import and export an agent if there is no capability set available. I think it will all fail badly if there is no capability set for an agent.

Also remember that there are also shared local and shared remote capability sets as well as the regular local and remote capability sets that get imported/exported.

These changes can be put into trunk.
fields.summary: Precurser to Import and Export of Elastic Agents
Backend Management of Elastic Agents
Create image build profile for production (as opposed to development) image

fields.description:
Please create a new builder plugin for Php.

This should support PHPUnit, which produces JUnit xml results. It also creates clover xml, so we can use the existing clover plugin to read coverage information. Similarly, checkstyle results are also provided by PHPUnit.
fields.summary: Create Php Builder Plugin

fields.description: We need this so that ongoing development doesn't break dogfood servers.

Improve agent logic to detect hostname and IP address

fields.description:
We have related builds that should not be run in parallel (say A1, A2, A3), while unrelated builds (D, E, F) can be run in parallel with A1, A2, A3.

Our only options seem to be:

1)  Define only one agent, and have all builds queue up to run (D, E, F have to wait for A1 to finish)
2)  Define multiple agents, but be unable to prevent certain builds from running in parallel (A1, A2 may run in parallel if triggered at around the same time).

Is there are way to build a configuration like this with the current feature set?
fields.summary: Allow control of which builds can be built in parallel

fields.description:
I thought there was already an issue open for this but I couldn't find it.  But I finally managed to reproduce this.

The P4 executable location is cached in the PerforceRepository class.  It only looks up the value if stored one is null.  This means that changes to the perforce capability are not always picked up.
fields.summary: P4Exe Is cached randomly

fields.description:
The "Changes" tab for a build is missing some changes that are in the build.  The missing changes show up in the subsequent build.

The subversion revision number in the "Metadata" is earlier than the sources that were built.  For example, the metadata indicates 41625 and the sources built are at least revision 41630.


Our build uses svn:externals to checkout portions of the repository to the proper places.  More build plan settings:

Repository: Subversion
Detect Changes in Externals: true
Quiet Period: 120
Maximum Retries: 5
Build Strategy: Repository Polling
Polling Frequency: 300
fields.summary: svn subversion revision and changes incorrect for a build

* Edit and Delete existing rules

No need to propagate these rules to anywhere on creation, but when creating agents these need to be retrievable to hand over to the agent.

fields.description:
Screen Requirements:
*  AWS Access Key ID
* AWS Secret Access Key (protected by a password-type text field)
* Maximum number of Elastic Instances (must be specified, no default, allowable range: 0 - number of remote agents allowed by license)
* Disclaimer stating they have accepted the terms and conditions
* Link to terms and conditions.
* Link to help information - where can they find the access key and secret access hey

Screen Functionality
* Add - validation that the details are correct (security group check stuff will be handled per agent creation).
* Edit 
** Access Key ID - validation that the details are correct, any running agents destroyed, recreate new elastic agents as necessary for the queue (there may be timing issues here)
** Secret Key - validation that details are correct
** Max Agents  - if reduced existing instances are terminated to enforce the limit. Preference is given to terminating idle instances, if increased new Elastic Instances are created in response to the current contents of the queue.  
* Disable - any running elastic agents destroyed

fields.description:
If user decided to cancel a build Bamboo shows it as a failed but I haven't seen anything that tell it was canceled and by whom.

It would be nice to add this indication to build status pages and to notifications (mail, etc.)
fields.summary: Cleary show that build was manually canceled

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo generates mail notification with subject like:

"[Bamboo] <Full Project Name> - <Full Build Plan Name> build <Build> was SUCCESSFUL (with <Number> tests). Change made by <User Name>"

Such  subject is really long and complicates subject reading for developers. Also some useful features are missing in mails. Could you please implement the following really simple enhancements? They are really simple to do:

- Provide +option+ to put short build name into subject instead of full project and build plan name. For example to have something like "[Bamboo] PRJ-PLANNAME-NUMBER was SUCCESSFUL (with <Number> tests). Change made by <User Name>"

- In case of tests failures it is really nice to see total number of tests and number of failed tests in the subject. It can be also +optional+. For example "...XX tests out of YYY failed...." or "...XXX/YYYY...". Or failed or successful tests percentage can be added.

- Provide an +option+ to set mail importance depending on build/test result. All failure messages can be sent with high importance and success mails can have low importance flag. Doing this will help to easily see the status in mail applications like Outlook. We had such a feature in custom build server and it was really useful.
fields.summary: Ability to modify Bamboo mail subject line

the necessity to shutdown bamboo properly is not explained in our documentation. killing bamboo as a process can lead to dataloss.
Please add the appropriate how to and why

fields.description: When entering global variables the whitespace gets trimmed off so you can't see it exists.  However, when they are used the whitespace still exists - this is confusing when trying to figure out where the extra spaces are coming from.

fields.description:
Currently each build log line is sent back from the agent to the server immediately. This means the logging performance (and sometimes build performance) is significantly impacted by latency. 

To improve the situation, we should batch up the logs and send them them intermittently.
fields.summary: Remote build logging can slow down a build

fields.description:
The gernerated url for _version_ is
....../Class.java?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&root=&revision=720508&r=720508#r720508
to be compatible with ViewVCS it should be
....../Class..java?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&root=&revision=720508#r720508

The generated url for _diff_ is
......./Class.java?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&root=&r1=720507&r2=720508

I don't know if that is supported in ViewVCS at all.
fields.summary: Change file list (Version) (diffs) in build results does not work for ViewCVS

fields.description:
Trying to export data from a Bamboo instance we have been demoing on the embedded DB so we can try it on our Oracle instance.  Export fails with the error "Adding text to an XML document must not be null" (looks like this is part of the AuthorMapper step).  I believe the issue probably stems from the fact that one user that is referenced in the Bamboo DB no longer exists in LDAP.

I see no way to delete this user, as when trying to bring up the user in the user list you can no longer locate it.  It does show up in the list of Authors, but clicking on the user name from that screen brings up the error "Unable to find the user. The username <uid> may be incorrect."

There needs to be either a way to proceed with the export or a way to cleanup the data so we can proceed.
fields.summary: Export fails with "Adding text to an XML document must not be null"

fields.summary: Entering incorrect project key gives big stack trace

fields.description:
In 2.1.4 we upgraded the svnkit library to 1.2.  This library will upgrade all svn working copies to 1.5.

There is a flag available {{svnkit.upgradeWC=true}} which will prevent it from upgrading any existing copies to 1.5 but all new checkouts will be 1.5

This should not cause any compatibility issues with the subversion server and should only surface as a problem if you are using a 1.4 client to perform operations on the code bamboo has checked out (e.g as part of your build)
fields.summary: Bamboo 2.1.4 forces SVN working copy to upgrade to 1.5

fields.description: Although Bamboo documentation claims that it supports cvs ext, pserver, and local repositories, an attempt to provide local path or a path preceded by a ":local:" prefix ends up with failure ("Cannot connect to CVS root: Cannot verify server connection. ").
fields.summary: Local cvs repositories are not supported

fields.description: currently no authorization is required - updateAndBuild.action is designed to work with repository scripts to push builds from the repository server. It is not designed to be used by 'users' from a random IP address. Thus the IP address of the repository has to be specified to make this command api call safe. Otherwise it is not safe and can be abused. The IP address field should *not* be optional. It should be dedicated to the repository IP address to avoid a possible remote attack.
fields.summary: REST API updateAndBuild.action can be abused if no IP address is specified

fields.description:
currently the remote client is presented with {noformat} A build of xyz project - PlanName was triggered by remote http call.{noformat} even when no build has been triggered due to no changes.
If no build is triggered due to no changes are present - then a different message should be displayed like {noformat} No changes found for project xyz - PlanName : no build triggered on bamboo host {noformat}
fields.summary: present a message to remote client if /api/rest/updateAndBuild.action?buildKey=PLAN-KEY did not trigger a build

fields.description: If a user is creating a new build plan and loses their connection prior to saving the completed plan, when they revisit the setup page, their previous plan contents should be restored from draft and a message should appear explaining that their draft was restored, with the option to discard it.
fields.summary: Save drafts of build plan progress and allow restore/discard action when revisiting

fields.description: Bamboo currently triggers an automatic build of each plan once the setup process is finished, and while it is still preferable to have this option enabled by default, it would be useful to add the ability to disable this behaviour. This would be most useful where there is a relatively large repository to be downloaded for a new build.
fields.summary: Add option to disable automatic building of new build plans

fields.description:
Have projects and plans hierarchically organized.
A child plan may inherit properties (like environmental variables, build targets, etc) of its parent.
Viewing build plans would be more organized and logically structured.
To change a property for all plans, we are forced to configure each single one through the web GUI.
fields.summary: Hierarchical Project and plan structure in Bamboo

!http://img.skitch.com/20081111-qpf9pmwb7rwdjkpnthm84pmhbt.png!

Plan: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/LAB-0XDEADBEEF
Build: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/LAB-0XDEADBEEF-4
fields.summary: Build Hang Prediction shows no logs for '299' minutes, even when messages are coming through.

fields.description: When a change applies to many plans, it often seems random which plan picks up the change first. I'd like to be able to manually reorder the build queue to bubble up a select plan so I can see how the change affects that plan as soon as possible after the change is checked in.
fields.summary: reorder the build queue

fields.description: If you look at the tabs on the dashboard the line/border at the top of the tabs seems to go behind the inactive tabs rather than in front.  See attached screen shots.
fields.summary: Very Minor UI issue with dashboard tabs

fields.description:
One of our customers today pointed out the perforce "where" command

You can specify the right hand side of the depot view like so
p4 -c clientname where -Ttag //clientname/bambooDev/...

and get useful information back, such as:
... tag tag
... depotFile //bambooDev/...
... clientFile //clientname/bambooDev/...
... path /p4-client-workspace/bambooDev/...

I am not sure what version of perforce this command is available and not sure how reliable it is,  but it is definitely worth some further investigation as we can cut down several of the perforce calls if we avoid retrieving client data.
fields.summary: Perforce can use "p4 where" command - Investigate

fields.description:
Changing the period on the View Tests Summary screen does nothing.  It always comes up as showing last 25 builds, no matter what is selected from the drop down.

Eg https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/build/setResultsFitler.action?returnUrl=%2Fbuild%2FviewTestsSummary.action%3FbuildKey%3DCONFFUNC-T5PG&buildKey=CONFFUNC-T5PG&filterController.selectedFilterKey=LAST_90_DAYS redirects to https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/build/viewTestsSummary.action?buildKey=CONFFUNC-T5PG
fields.summary: Tests summary screen always shows last 25 builds

fields.description:
Cloning plans is great, but often you want to clone all the plans in a project for a different source point. For example, on bamboo.developer.atlassian.com, most projects have three plans: TRUNK, STABLE and PREVSTABLE. Each new project is typically identical, except that it points to a different SVN location.

It would be fantastic to have a 'clone project' option, which lets you:

a) check the plans you want to include in the new clone
b) specify a couple of typical modifications (ie, SVN/CVS repository)
c) Clone!
fields.summary: Clone Project

fields.description:
Our windows installer build (https://jira2.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JWI-ENT) has it's test-reports directory set to: subprojects/installer/target/TEST*.xml

For some reason since the Bamboo upgrade to 2.2-SNAPSHOT, this was reset back to **/test-reports/*.xml.  I also can't change it back now.  It always defaults back to **/test-reports/*.xml.

Can this be fixed ASAP please since our windows installer build is failing because of it :).
fields.summary: Test results directory can't be updated
After deleting the last build result, the dashboard still tries to link there.

fields.description:
The Status Summary Screen is great. My group is even thinking of devoting a monitor to its display on a wall. One addition to the status summary that would be useful would be the little animated icons that appear on the "My Bamboo" and "All Plans" tabs. I've attached a picture to show what I mean. With the icons added, we could tell not only the status of the last build, but the status of the plan as well.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add plan status indicator icon to Status Summary Screen

fields.description: Under certain situations multiple user of the same username may be exported
fields.summary: Exporting from LDAP with duplicate users may lead to a invalid export file
Ability to delete comments

fields.description:
When you're editing Artifact rules it puts the columns in the order Name, Wildcard, Directory.

When you view them it puts them in the order Name, Directory, Wildcard

This is inconsistent and should be both the same (I prefer Name, Directory, Wildcard, as it more clearly indicates the wildcard applies to the directory).
fields.summary: Artifact editing/viewing screens are inconsistent in the order of the columns

fields.description: If you are typing a comment for a build, and that build is running in the background, an update to the Latest status in the top right will clear the comment form.  I was typing a comment for a build that was running.  As soon as that build finished, the page was refreshed and I lost my comment.
fields.summary: Latest status of a build may clear comment form

fields.description:
A child build should be able to use the variables from a parent build. 

For Example, A version varialble created in the parent build plan should get passed to a child plan responsible for deployment
fields.summary: In order to have pass control to child build plans, Bamboo should have an option of passing variables between parent and child builds.

fields.description:
Whenever an agent is started, Bamboo needs to check for the existence of an "elasticbamboo" EC2 security group in the configured  AWS account.  If it does not exist, it needs to be created, with appropriate firewall rules.

All elastic agents need to be created within this security group.
fields.summary: Check for and create and use EC2 security group with appropriate firewall rules
Blanket fix for xwork vulnerability
